intro: Lobostemon trigonus, commonly known as the three-angled bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its distinctive three-angled stems and bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers, which range in color from white to purple, bloom in spring and are often clustered at the ends of the stems. Lobostemon trigonus is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique foliage and floral display.
